pullRequest.title: Persist all flowunits into a single SQL stable
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #, if available:
#100
Description of changes:
Currently the way how we persist flowunit is to create separate SQL table for each individual RCA. This will cause problem if we have multiple cluster level RCAs and each has a summary attached to it. So the summary table can only be linked to one RCA table through its foreign key and if we want to insert another summary row with a different foreign key, the SQL will fail because of the foreign key constraint. And it does not make too much sense to maintain multiple tables for each RCA as those tables have exact same schema.
In this PR, we combined all RCA tables into a single "FlowUnit" table so it can be joined with summary table without any issue.
Tests:
tested on docker
Code coverage percentage for this patch:
n/a
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that my contribution is made under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license.

commit.message: Persist all flowunit into a single SQL stable

nodes.bodyText: A private method does not need to be synchronized if the upper level public method is
At some point we need to change the name of this class. This is not dummy but the actual entry point to the RCA framework
I think we should add a class level javadoc comment saying what are the tables in the SQLite database and what are the columns for each. And also add an example tables filled with data for each
Please add a javadoc comment for the public method while we are at it
